title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4.158 - Executive Order No. 158: Naming the New Scotland Avenue Laboratory Building the David Axelrod Institute for Public Health
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4.158 - Executive Order No. 158: Naming the New Scotland Avenue Laboratory Building the David Axelrod Institute for Public Health

State Regulations
WHEREAS, the research and public health service activities
carried out in the Wadsworth Center for Laboratories and Research of the New

York State Department of Health provide comprehensive and vital health services
to the citizens of New York; WHEREAS, viral and bacterial diseases and epidemics
affecting the public, such as AIDS, tuberculosis, genetic abnormalities, Lyme
disease and sexually transmitted diseases, are being identified, analyzed and
studied at the site; WHEREAS, the Wadsworth Center for Laboratories and Research
is the preeminent public health laboratory in the nation, having contributed
pioneering international research achievements; WHEREAS, the New Scotland Avenue laboratory building of the

Wadsworth Center for Laboratories and Research is a state-of-the-art scientific
complex that will allow scientists to work on the most perplexing and
potentially hazardous diseases in a safe environment, allowing them to make
significant contributions to public health; WHEREAS, David Axelrod, M.D. began his State service in the

Wadsworth Center for Laboratories and Research, and was the first State

Commissioner of Health whose career began there; WHEREAS, Dr. Axelrod served with distinction in the

Wadsworth Center for 11 years, first as Director of Infectious Diseases and
then as Director of the laboratories, and, as Commissioner, brought the
exacting standards of scientific proof and peer review of the center to the
making of public policy, thereby setting a standard of excellence for all to
follow; and
WHEREAS, David Axelrod was unafraid of the challenges
revealed and brought forward by scientific research; NOW, THEREFORE, I, Mario M. Cuomo, Governor of the State of

New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and Laws
of the State of New York, and in solemn respect for the achievements and honor
brought to the State of New York by the work of David Axelrod, and for his
passion for the cause of public health and the application of honest science to
the problems of government, do hereby proclaim and direct that the New Scotland

Avenue laboratory building in the City of Albany shall hereafter be known as
the David Axelrod Institute for Public Health. Signed: Mario M. Cuomo

Dated: June 23, 1992
